intro: Trollius buddae, commonly known as the Buddhist flower, is a rare and delicate plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the genus Trollius, which includes various species of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow, daisy-like flowers that bloom in late summer. Trollius buddae thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows.
